name: Jessica the perfectionist
review: I haven't used many mineral makeups but I've looked at them a long time, but never found one I was willing to spend money on that looked like it would work. This works! It goes on very easy and has a slight cool feeling like its liquid powder (if that makes sense). I have noticed the slight shimmer but that is what makeup does. the "shimmer" reflects the light to minimize any imperfections in your skin. I have found that you cannot use a different type of concealer or pressed powder with it. I apply my concealer after my foundation and I found that it turned the color of the mineral makeup and got cakey where I had applied the concealer. It does have good effective coverage, but be sure not to use too much as the more you apply the darker your tone will become. I'm almost out so I'm definitely going to buy more. I think it's quicker too than applying a liquid foundation, then concealer, then pressed powder. It doesn't have impressive staying power, however I've heard of a trick of misting hairspray on your face or in the air and then putting your face through the mist that seems to help your makeup last longer. Hope this helps you!

name: Julie
review: I bought this product looking for a new finishing powder to lightly dust over my foundation. I found this product to be too shimmery and it didn't spread out well. The L'oreal True Match finishing powder is MUCH better. Also, the brush is terrible, but you should expect that.

name: KelseyB
review:
After reading all the reviews on this site and others, I have to admit that I was pretty hesitant about buying this product. Below I'll explain what I was looking for and what I got out of Revlon ColorStay Aqua

What I was looking for:
Light-Medium coverage
Blendable
Natural-looking
Wont seep into/exaggerate pores and fine lines
Possibly a liquid-to-powder foundation

What I got:
Easy to build coverage
SUPER blendable (worn over pure vitamin E oil)
Feels AMAZING - cooling, refreshing, moist
Looks very natural - dewy yet matte...oh, and the "sparkles" others referred to....not so! It's a very SLIGHT shimmer that I hardly noticed at all
Makes my skin look beautiful - pores and fine line...bye bye!

Overall, I am very happy. I have used countless mineral foundations always to find that I look "dusty" or powdery...fuzzy even. Not happy with that. This foundation gives me the lightweight feel of a powder with the smoothing perfection of a liquid. I do agree - probably not for people with uneven skin surfaces, acne scars, or those who desire full coverage makeup!

name: Raye
review:
First of all, I consider the brush that is included in the lid to be TRASH. This may be user malfunction, but I achieve much better coverage by buffing this product on with a kabuki brush.

Anyway, I am very pleased with the lightweight and SPF coverage this product provides! As a disclaimer, I've recently started wearing makeup in the past year. However, I've used many (probably between 10 and 15) powders and mineral makeups. On days that I do not wear a "full face" of makeup, I wear only this. On "full face" days, I layer this over my liquid foundation. It has great coverage and it certainly doesn't scream "Hey, look at me and my makeup mask!" It definitely lets my skin breathe. I have oily, acne-prone skin and hyperpigmentation on my cheeks. This product does not break me out and does a great job of soothing/covering my blemishes and bright red patches.

My mom, who also has rosacea on her cheeks, actually recommended this product to me. I couldn't pass it up after hearing her rave reviews!

Also worth noting is that I live in a very hot and humid climate. This product does not make my face itch or gather and drip down my face when I sweat. Yes, I need to touch up after lunch if I apply this in the morning before work. But that does not upset me, as I've never truly used a mineral makeup that didn't need a little bit of a touch up by the end of the day. I've tried BareMinerals and was very pleased with it, but not enough to shuck out the cash and quit buying this product.

I have used this product for roughly four days a week for a year and have been through three containers. Considering the value and price of this product, I am very pleased!

name: Molly Wobbles
review: I use this product only in places that need extra coverage ie: splotchy skin or zits after I've applied my tinted moisturizer. It is very light and powdery almost bare minerals like- and it's easy to layer the coverage from light to heavy. I'm fair skinned so powder can look fake and noticeable, this one isn't. The brush comes in the top of the cover and its kind of awkward to take it out, shake some powder into the inside of the cover and dab it on where I need it. A little fussy, but it looks like it will last me a long time.

name: JETG
review: This powder was soft and cool on application but had no staying powder compared to many other similar brands. I would not buy this again.

name: Emi
review: I use it on my eyelids, so my eyeliner stays put & is more long lasting.

name: Ulta Lover
review: best i used so far!

name: Sailtheplains
review:
I have extremely sensitive skin. Because of a condition called Lupus, almost all make ups and skin products cause breakouts, scarring and extensive facial peeling that leaves my skin red and raw. I've tried countless brands and different products. I had been recommended to try the Bare Minerals line but then I happened to see this Revlon mineral powder--obviously for about a quarter of the price.

I decided to try it. So far, it feels nice when I put it on--soothing--though it does seem to take more than other powders to get the coverage you want. But you also get more powder in the little case. I haven't had a big problem with the makeup peeling off (taking my skin with it)--so this may be the one that I end up sticking with.

It was a little difficult to skin match but it blends pretty well. I would recommend it for others that have skin sensitivity problems.

name: Jonesy7
review: Love this foundation! I used to use Maybelline Mineral Foundation and I found that it made my face itch when I got hot. This foundation is like a dream! You can feel it go into an almost liquid form as you blend it into your skin. It's light, easy coverage without the messiness of a liquid foundation or the dryness of a powder!

name: KARRIE
review: wORKS VERY WELL FOR ME.

name: ShoeJunkie
review: This product was recommended on a blog as a "drugstore dupe" to the BareMinerals foundation, and was said to offer great coverage over uneven skin tone and blemishes. I do not find this product to offer much coverage, and it does not stay on well without a foundation primer. It's not a great "dupe" and I would rather splurge the $30 for the foundation I know will offer great coverage, no fail.

name: Bratty Catty
review: Easy to apply and feels great. Not heavy or greasy.

name: gabbygail
review: This mineral powder feels amazing as you apply it.  It really feels like water.  Unfortunately, it has hardly any coverage and leaves way too much of a shimmer on your face.  If you have flawless skin, then this is the powder for you.  If you have anything that you want to coverup, then this is not for you.

name: Rosie
review: I love the feeling of the moisture in the product. Doesn't last as long as I would like.

name: mama
review: This powder is very light and blends very well so it doesn't leave you with a caked on feeling. Although it's very sheer I am able to add more powder on the tip of the brush to  conceal any blemishes when necessary. The only problem I've had is having the brush unhinge while in use thus popping back into the plastic casing. I am able to overlook that because I love the texture of the powder, but it's a little annoying.

name: FrenchieSally
review: I have been using this powder for a while and really love it.  It is easy to apply, not much of the product is needed, and it is long-lasting.  One thing I really love about it is the cool touch the powder has when it hits my skin, almost like it is wet.  The coverage is light, but enough to give my skin a flawless look.

name: jude
review: Like the idea to be faster than the  normal way I use a foundation.

name: Dani Harris
review: I use this everyday and it is the only product that doesn't clog my pires. The makeup loves my skin and it shows it looks very natural  without looking like I have a ton of makeup on.

name: Elizabeth
review:
I love this loose powder foundation because it covers well, looks natural, and doesn't cake or show lines, etc. It is very easy to use, and lightweight.
It is also kind to my skin; doesn't clog pores and is very lightweight.
Since it is a loose powder, it can be a bit messy. I always put it on while standing in front of my bathroom sink. that way any loose trails fall into the sink. Maybe I just use a little too much! haha! Touch-ups are a breeze, too.
I prefer to use my full-size brush to apply this product.

name: Robin
review: I love this product. It's as good as any expensive powder plUs its moisturizing. It feels damp when it goes on but dries quickly.

name: Tabby T
review: I love this loose powder over foundation....it leaves you with a flawless finish... And it stays on throughout the whole day. Try it you will love it!

name: Sabrina
review: This did not cover skin imperfections. I am very disappointed. I purchased this instead of Bare Minerals. Huge mistake.

name: Juli
review: I did like the feel of this but I prefer more coverage
I would not purchase this item again.

name: C Gro
review: Once I started using this particular mineral makeup, I don't want to use anything else.

name: Deanne
review: Every day coverage!

name: PinkGirl212
review: It feels really neat but not good coverage. It looks splotchy.

name: Jen
review: This product is the best on the market of it's type . It has a refreshing light and natural feel.

name: Rach
review: This doesn't offer much coverage and it doesn't stay put. I love the liquid makeup and thought that this would be like the liquid in a mineral form. It's not. I will use it for hot summer days when I will be outdoors and just need a bit of coverage to even me out.

name: Great Dane
review: like other mineral makeups for full coverage you have to apply several layers and I have not found a primer from revlon so I have to use bare minerals foundation primer which is a much more expensive line of makeup... Wish I could find a primer by Revlon that would be more cost effective.

name: Banda
review: I use my own brush to apply rather than the small danky brush they give you. I actually use that brush to help blend my concealer into the foundation. It has an awesome refreshing feeling once it is on your skin. But everything else suck, its messy, horrible for a going out look. It's got a natural look which i like, but it doesn't last long.

name: Redsavvy729
review: I was trying to find the Revlon Colorstay foundation (I love that stuff!) but could only find this in the stores. It looked similar except the "Aqua" part so I figured I'd try it. First impression: it feels so refreshing on the skin, but the coverage is very inconsistent. I have fair skin and my skin is splotchy without any make-up on, so I need something that goes on evenly. It also feels dry and looks cakey within hours after application, which I hate. And lastly, it doesn't work well with bronzers. The more "layers" of this stuff I'd put on to try and even it out, the less bronzer would stick to my face, resulting in a zebra stripe effect. Very strange. I've been wearing makeup and buying products for 20 years and this is possibly the worst product I've ever tried on my face. Hate it.

name: Simple Jack
review: When I first applied I thought the brush was wet but soon realized that was the product.  I didn't have a problem with that, it actually felt good.  But the coverage was non existent and my skin looked worse by mid day than if I hadn't worn makeup at all.  Not liking this stuff at all.

name: turquoiselover81
review: This powder is absolutely easy to apply "if" you have the right brush to apply it with. Its has a light-weight coverage that leaves your face feeling refreshed at the same time giving you a natural smooth finish!! I also use the ColorStay Mineral Mousse foundation before apply this. If you are looking for a thicker/heavier powder to cover up  imperfections, this isn't for you. I love, love, love this product!!

name: Jan
review: I would not recomment this to a friend because the container is too small and it's a very small amount for the money.  Too pricy.

name: mandeerg
review: i did not like this...it has too much shimmer in it and the coverage was to light for me. it feels wet to the skin which feels super weird but pretty cool to lol thats really my only positive.

name: Bellie
review:
It goes on smooth and does not crease on wrinkles.
Covers even on dark spots. I just thought it was great and very easy to apply.Gives my skin a natural look.

name: Neec
review: This product is close to Bare Minerals with a lower price.  I had a coupon which knocked a few dollars off so thought I'd replish my original buy. It has a cool feeling when applying.  Nice!  The coverage is light but enough and doesn't feel heavy.  I don't use the brush on top as it seems too small and texture of nylon. Rather, I use a big brush made of natural fibers.  It's a good size and easy to see when you're running low. It's also easy to match your skin tone.

name: MOMOF3
review:
I love how it feels and how easily it goes on!
I've had to learn to close my eyes because it tends to dry them out if it gets in them.

name: Alley
review: Feels cool on my face when I apply it.

name: Always Outdoors
review: Marketed as "aqua" makeup. I misinterpreted that to mean stays on in water. Instead, it feels like small bursts of cool water on you face as you apply it.

name: Sandy the Decorator
review: I just love the way it feels when you apply it!  It has a cool sensation to it and goes on really smooth and light not at all heavy!  I really do not have a complaint about it!

name: Sandy Sun
review: It was interesting.  The feel was very wet.  It doesn't cover as well as Bare Minerals.

name: Anna Nymph
review:
I have extremely fair skin and even the lightest shades of foundation are often too dark for me. But the lightest of this is absolutely perfect! And it covers up the red spots and old acne scars perfectly. I bought this just yesterday and I know I want to stock up.
It has a different feel going on than any other foundation I've tried because of the cooling sensation but once you get used to it it's a very nice refreshing sensation. Love it!! I defiantly recommend trying it!

name: Maddie
review: This product is amazing! My face feels and looks like there isn't any makeup on, but it still looks flawless. It's just like bareminerals!! Although the cooling effect will catch you off guard the first time you use it, you'll keep coming back to it! The only down side to this make-up is the brush, it takes awhile to apply! My advice: Use a bronzer on top to set the minerals in place

name: henny
review: Unbleieveable refreshing feeling on skin , upon application.

name: kay
review: finally a foundation that is light but still gives medium coverage

name: Dean
review: I just love the coverage - not heavy

name: Buster
review: I like the original minerals 100% better

name: Fair Rose
review: Not messy like most mineral make up.  I like the cooling sensation but prefer more coverage and quicker application.

name: Makeup Chick
review: The dry to wet is very cool. But it lacks in coverage. I have a few blemishes and redness around my nose and it doesn't cover it very well. This stuff is very light. I'll prob use this in the summer.

name: ceegee58
review: Maybe I just didn't realize that this mineral powder make-up is WET!!  It didn't cover well at all, and it was hard to apply.  I hated this make-up, it was a total waste of my money.  Thank goodness it wasn't expensive.

name: Ultimate ULTA fanatic
review: This mineral makeup feels wet when it touches your skin. I recommend using a foundation brush for application and blending.

name: hannah
review: I'm very fair and was surprised the color was a good match.  The product goes on well, feels good, and gives light to moderate coverage.  Once outside, both my teenaged daughters asked if I had put glitter on my face.  We went and brought the product outside and tested on hands and their faces.  It sparkles!  Not a light shimmer or a luminesent look, but sparkles like a fine glitter.  Not a good look for a mature mom of three.   Neither of my daughters would consider wearing this daily.   It is now in th theatre/stage make-up box.  I wish the company would make a more matte version,  liked the color and feel.

name: Bee
review: I have sensitive skin and my face tends to break out with a lot of the foundation make ups, but not with this one.  It feels like it is nourishing my skin.

name: PC
review: I am really disappointed in this product and even more diappointed that I can no longer get the original Color Stay mineral foundation. This product goes on feeling wet, so it is heavier and doesn't feel natural. Also, because it goes on wet it seems to soak into my pores and make them look larger instead of gliding over them. It also sets into the few minor wrinkles under my eyes and makes them look deeper. I will be looking to other product lines for a better mineral foundation now, which is sad because I soooo LOVED the original version in this line.

name: April
review: Very disappointed. I want my money back.

name: Drey
review: Every bit as good as bare minerals at half the price.  The application brush is pretty useless though, I use my kabuki brush for best application.

name: Susan
review: Good pruduct, easy to apply good coverage. However goes on feeling wet at first. This was a shock, thought I had gotten my brush wet, until I relized it was the product.

name: Heather
review: I love the feeling of this powder going on. It has a wonderful cooling sensation and feels damp when you apply it but isn't. It has a light coverage but goes beautifully over other foundations for a complete, full coverage if that's what you re looking for. Wayne Goss (YouTube makeup artist) suggested putting your moisturizer on, then primer, then powder (yes BEFORE foundation), and then your foundation for all day hold and this actually works perfectly for that use and stays on ALL day. Never need to touch up even after 16 hours. This is a wonderful powder and I actually purchased several bottles just in case I can't find it again. Never can have too much of a good thing!!

name: TCMeacham
review: HATE THIS! It feels wet when you put it on, and as soon as it is applied to your skin it darkens considerably! I have used regular mineral foundation in the past and it has been wonderful. I saw that this one advertises for moisturizing, which I thought I would try since I have dry skin. Total waste of money. NO coverage, just looks like I rubbed carrot juice all over my face.

name: doxielady
review: Takes seconds to apply, no blending required. No visible lines. Makes skin look healthy, like you're not even wearing makeup

name: PandaDash
review:
I had been needing a new powder to set my foundation since I'm almost out of my two faced powder and this one was in the clearance section for $5 I figured why not try it when I tried it it felt as if the powder was really damp it made my brush slightly wet and it was hard to lightly dust the powder on without smearing my foundation.

To apply it I used the body sculpting brush by Ecotools (I would really recommend that brush) and lightly brushed the powder all over my face

name: raye
review: This lives up to its name Aqua, when you apply it is so cool literally. It feels wet actually, but it isn't. It's so smooth and lat very long. It covers so will I would say it would cover well without Foundation.

name: Riley
review: look really cakey under my eyes and the brush gets like dirty dirty after one use and does apply well

name: CDs
review: Great!

name: Mama Kash
review: I was trying to replace a powder foundation that had been discontinued. I found that there was little to no coverage so I wouldn't really call it a foundation. Also, there were little specks of glitter within the powder which I did not care for.

name: Niki
review: I love revlon products, they have beautiful coverage and color pay off without clogging my oily pores. I like the cool feeling when applying this powder.

name: Melissa
review: This powder is beautiful and it feels very cool/wet when applied to the skin (I love it). Beautiful finish. I used the brush that comes with it, and love that brush. Would be nice if there were more colors.

name: Bella Blue
review: It was nice in the beginning. i liked the cool "aqua" feeling. I liked the small shimmer. The thing that really irritates me is that I have a great mineral brush and I make sure my face is nicely hydrated and still the make up looks dry and just blah. I am 21 with moderate acne. The coverage is poor and goes away quickly. Not worth the money and hopefully I will find a better product.

name: Courtney
review: Ugh, when I put it on to set my foundation, it just looked so unnatural.  Even if you put a little bit, you can still see it and it looks ruddy.

name: Unknown
review: Made all pores appear large.

name: bekahh13
review: I love this product! I love how it feels like your putting water on your face... its lightweight. what I don't like is how theirs little sparkles.. but great coverage .l

name: Diva
review: I do love the powder, I love how cool it feels when it goes on but I absolutely HATE the packaging, I want to be able to use a puff/sponge to put the powder on. I don't think the brush really distributes enough or any product on my face. Get rid of the fancy packaging, let ME get to the product and use a puff.

name: Chubby Rat
review: For my sensitive, aging, dry skin, this is the best foundation I've ever used. It gives moderate coverage that stays on and, if you get the right color, is nearly undetectable. My job requires me to be outdoors in the cold and this product works beautifully to cover up the shiny red 'outdoor nose'. As far as application goes, I found it very easy to apply, even with the tiny attached brush, but I have used mineral makeup exclusively for well over 10 years and can apply it in my sleep. The only criticism I've got is the limited color range. Hopefully the line will catch on and they can add a few more colors for us oddly colored girls. Otherwise, great product.

name: Jim the Runner
review: Feels wet while going on, sort odd, but it's pretty food makeup.

name: JosieR
review: I decided to try a new mineral powder and I picked this one by Revlon. I had the Bare Minerals mineral powder and it just seemed too shiny for my skin type. This mineral powder is very nice. I'm not sure about the color--I always have trouble matching my very fair skin with reddish undertones--but I think I may buy another bottle that is one shade lighter and mix the two. It goes on with a very "cool" sensation and it lasts all day. I use a big powder brush to apply it, as the brush that comes with it is just too small.

name: camomile7
review: I really love this product all around. It feels great on. My only comlaint is the brush that it comes with is worthless so don't even try to apply the makeup with it. Instead use a foundation brush from Ulta

name: Jorie
review: I use this product daily.  I like the fact that it is a mineral product.  And is not too pricey.

name: drylips
review: I buy this for my mom and she loves the cooling effect.  It feels more liquid when applied.  I find it difficult to blend properly with my kabuki brush and haven't found the right brush to use aside from the one that comes with it but my mom uses it on top of her liquid foundation and has repurchased several times

name: Kris
review: The color matches up perfectly and doesn't change color or go "orange" through the course of the day.  Great stuff.

name: VP
review: Did not like it all. I do not like liquid make up, so to have a powder make up gon on feeling wet was disscusting.  I couldnt even give it away to co-workers.

name: Ariel
review: I do not use foundation, so having a great loose finishing powder is important to me. The coverage and color were good, it just had a heavier feel then I am used to. It almost felt like I was wearing a full coverage foundation. I want my skin to breath. It would be great for someone who likes a heavier product.

name: NevadaAnn
review: Change the packaging.

name: Ren
review: This product is really great! I love a lightweight foundations. Although I wish I had gotten a darker shade because the coverage is verrrrry light. It looks nice with a slight shimmer to make your face looking healthy. It covers all blemishes, but not acne.. So if you want to cover acne you'll have to use a separate concealer. But it looks natural and its great for acne prone skin. My face actually looks healthier and has less breakouts now that I've started using this product. My skin is dry on some spots so it's nice that this foundation keeps my face moisturized. But it does not get cakey or make your skin feel healthy/thick/oily at the end of the day, which IS THE BEST. The only thing, is that its pricey.

name: mrs.G
review: this product is great. AMAZING coverage.

name: Tnt
review: Easy to use, great coverage

name: Angeliis
review: This stuff can be applied as light or heavy as you need.  It is more like a pancake if ANY moisture is on your face, so i recommend washing your face before applying.  It is also not good for a long day of anything.  It does rub off, get on clothes (so it is not color stay) and it tends to get really greasy after a few hours of wear.

name: Jodi
review: I was pleased with the coverage and liked the moisture aspect(my face didn't itch like it has w/ some other mineral makeup).

name: N/A
review: This does not have coverage at all. you can not tell that you are even wearing makeup.

name: Sabritas
review: Smooth but doesn't apply on great

name: Aariele
review: I've been using this for 10+ years and absolutely love it.

name: Deb
review: Stays on all day and in hot weather

name: Bellyrina
review:
I have been using this since it first came out. I have tried other brands throughout the years, but always come back to this one. I love how moisturizing & soft it is for being a powder. The color I found it perfect for my skin tone - not too orange or too beige like so many foundations are. I can wear it light or put it on heavy. It still looks good. Now that contouring is a big thing I contour and then put this all over my face to blend everything together for a nice smooth natural look.

I don't use the silly little brush that comes with it... I recommend using a Kabuki.

name: Bernibaby
review: Use this because it feels good, cool especially for summer time.

name: Bemmer
review: I could see the powder sitting on top of my skin. Odd feeling of coolness during application. Had another Reclon Coloratay mineral powder that I used to love and this wasn't it.

name: JRO
review:
Let me begin with the positive, this mineral powder is light weight, won't clog your pores, and is non drying/hydrating to the skin.

The negative, if you wear a sunscreen or moisturizer under this, the product will not blend well, it leaves dark colored pathes all over your face. So I end up wearing it after I wash my face without sunscreen or moisturizer. If Revlon would add a good amount of SPF to this mineral powder it will be worth repurchasing. I like Revlon products overall, but this one needs to be much improved upon.

name: Marie
review: Good product for the price. Provides good coverage.

name: Deb
review: Wish I could find this in the light color for winter, had to use something else and didnt like it.

name: millicent mouse
review: has a great feeling when putting it on

name: makeupchiccaa
review: Just doesn't work ..

name: sam
review: Liked as much as more expensive mineral makeups

name: KiKi
review: I love this product. Compared to Bare Minerals it is not drying or heavy in texture. You don't feel all made up. Its light and natural and covers very well.

name: missarahbeth
review: I liked the application process.  It looks great as I apply it in the morning, however it does not last all day.  My t-zone ends up super oily.  Not sure if they have one for combination skin or not.  This would be great for dry skin.

name: Astee
review: The powder is working wonder when using with a normal size mineral brush, in my case I'm using the BE brush. I think it's such a bad idea that Revlon includes the brush with the package, it makes people think the product is bad, but trust me if you use a different powder brush with it, you're going to like what you feel and see on your face.

name: luxorjan
review: This product offers next to no coverage.  While there is a pleasurable cooling sensation on application, it is difficult to apply, even using a good quality brush.

name: vv
review: A light cool feeling.  I love it!

name: Savannah
review: I had used Bare minerals for a long time and thought I wanted a change and something cheaper. This Revlon Colorstay mineral makeup works even better than the Bare minerals- staying put longer and feeling smoother and lighter when brushed onto my face.  The color blends in better as well.  And I never would have thought it was less than HALF the price of other mineral makeups!  LOVE IT

name: JUDY
review: The brush is totally useless.  I didn't care for the wet gritty feel.  Made my skin look powdery and dry.  I am sick that I wasted my money.

name: JRZY GRL
review: I was surprised that the minerals are wet...aqua is the correct name.  It is easy to apply and looks really nice on.

name: Amanda
review: It feels great going on and matches my skin tone.

name: sweetchildk
review: I use this product with Revlon ColorStay Foundation. This makes for super long lasting coverage! Even after excersizing the make up looks good!! Two draw backs...the powder will come off a bit if I am not careful when I hug ;) Also I do not like the brush that comes with the powder. I use an all over face brush to apply the powder.

name: Hales
review: Easy application & smooth look

name: firechick
review: When you put it on it feels "wet" and "cool", covers great, lasts all day, controls oil and doesn't feel heavy.  I rarely find a product that I can say I LOVED, but this is definately one of them!

name: Danielle
review: Covers well! Haven't used anything else since finding this

name: Rocky
review: I usually cannot just use a powder because I have oily skin and I don't feel like powders give enough coverage; however, this product goes on and really last for hours. I love the cool sensation it has when it is first applies.  I don't like to look or feel like I have a lot of makeup on and this product gives me the right amount if coverage for day wear.  I am becoming a big fan of Revlon products.

name: Heidi
review: Blends easily and isn't heavy

name: Jami E
review: I use this over a tinted moisturizer & it gives my skin a "soft focus" look. It evens everything out & has a nice finish. I don't know how much coverage you would get wearing it by itself, you might need to spot conceal blemishes. But it should help hide redness, and your skin will still look like skin. I bought it at half off, wait until it's on sale or you have a coupon.

name: Precious
review: Loved the feel of this as I apply it to my face - feel moist and cool.

name: Slyvonne
review: I have used this for many bottles . It works on my forehead without settling in lines or pores .Covers well also .No other foundation works as well without showing the flaws for me on my forehead .

name: Bibi
review:
I was excited when I bought it thought it would replace my Bare minerals
I liked the product but I saw sparkles on my face this product is luminous so a no no for me although I like the finish,i returned it just for this reason.

name: Suzy
review: I have used this product  for two years now and love it

name: Makeup Mommy
review: If I was wearing this to go out at night as a highlighter over my regular powder, it may work out but for daily wear it was too sparkly for me.

name: Ileana
review: It's  got the right coverage and  doesn't change foundation color

name: Danie
review: I liked the product but I is not as good as bare minerals.

name: V
review: over my foundation.

name: Rosie
review: I use this product daily. I like the feeling of moisture in the powder.

name: Liz
review: This product is comparable to bare minerals. So happy I found it

name: V
review: easy to apply.

name: Mary
review:
Used Prescriptives "Magic" powder and became addicted to the dewy moisture it provided to my 50+ age skin. Was totally upset when Prescriptives disappeared and am now thrilled to find something like it in this product.
While the coverage is on the light side, this product feels beautiful on your face, bringing a burst of fresh, dewy moisture that feels wonderful and makes your face look alive.

name: pat
review: light weight--doesn't feel like make-up--skin can breath

name: Lis818
review: This is seriously the worst foundation I have EVER bought.  And no, I don't like a ton of coverage.  I generally just wear a tinted moisturizer with some bronzer over it.  This product is literally sheer.  You may as well use it as a glittery setting powder.  I did kinda like the wet feeling, though.  But the product is SO bad.

name: Jen
review: Have you ever dropped your brush in the sink and then used it to apply mineral makeup and it feels wet and weird?  That is how this product feels when it is applied.  Within 3 hours my face was greasy!  I wish I would have kept the receipt.

name: Gia
review: Product feel like its wet, great sensation! Could have a bigger brush or have a bigger one to purchase

name: Micki
review: I really wanted to like this product as I used to be a fan of Bare Minerals. I am over 40 and have combination skin. Bare Minerals was always too dry for my wrinkle prone areas, so I thought I would give this product a try. It goes on smoothly, but it takes a lot of application to get full coverage. This product would be better for someone who maybe had a normal or sensitive skin type and wanted a translucent coverage.

name: Product Police
review:
This product has a pleasant cooling sensation upon contact. I also noticed a subtle sparkle and dewey effect from the minerals which was nice. I was also pleased that the fair tint of this product actually matched my skintone - I'm very fair and it's difficult to find a match for my complexion.
However, it becomes damp and difficult to apply. I noticed that it sank into fine lines and pores which was unflattering. At the end of the day, the make-up caused my face to become COMPLETELY DRY. I had blotchy dry patches that turned red and started to peel. I stopped using the make-up and applied heavy lotion to the affected areas and luckily my face cleared up within two to three days. I put a swatch of the make-up on my hand for a couple of days to test it, and the same thing happened. I have no allergies and have used a variety of make-up brands and this is the first time any allergic reaction has occurred. I would never recommend this product to anyone.

name: Joanie
review: Easy to use.  Great if I don't want to wear regular makeup.

name: EKW
review: The feeling when you apply is nice, but the coverage and overall effectiveness is poor. Would never buy again.

name: Holly
review: Have no idea where they go the idea that his was anything other than face powder. The dampness is pretty neat-feeling, but the fact remains it works no better than regular face powder.

name: Beauty Addict
review: I have used Bare Minerals for the past five years and thought I would give this a shot! I love the feel of it going on and it gives me wonderful coverage! I thought the brush that came with it was a little to small, so I still use the Bare Minerals Brush.

name: Rachael
review: I have olive skin and have had aweful acne my whole life.  I got stopped several times today at the mall with woman complimenting me on my skin!  I'm 27 and they thought I was 18 years old!  My acne and marks don't show at all, you just need to use a kabuki brush, I use the little one they give you to do touch-ups and conceal dark spots before I apply it with the kabuki.  I'm a make up junkie, and I use to buy BM, but never again!  This is the best!

name: MEEEEE!!!! :D
review: i bought this product thinking it would feel like any other powder but i was kinda amazed at the wet feeling it has lol. i dont like how sparly it is.  it has a slightly off tone from my skin but its hardly noticable. i've only been wearing makeup for a couple months so i've been experimenting with different things, especially mineral foundation because i like to take care of my skin. i think there is probably alot better mineral fopundations out there for the same, or better price.

name: Megan
review: This product feels very good going on because it feels wet but it covers nothing. The only thing it did for my face is make it look tanner. It didnt cover 1 single thing on my face. Do not recomend this product.

name: Songmom
review: This is my new foundation. Not too pink, not too yellow. Blends beautifully and lasts all day.

name: Barbii
review: This product is horrible! It is a powder but is wet when you dip your brush in it so it is impossible to blend. The product just kind of sits on your skin and made me break out terribly. It was just overall disgusting. I wouldn't use again and would never recommend it to anyone.

name: spellcaster!
review: after more than 20 years of liquid foundations,this is a fresh aprouch to clean and light make-up! i love it! no need to re-apply because it never melts off.finally the best in basics!

name: Green Jean
review: Wonderful product - feels great when you apply it and lasts all day!

name: misslulu
review: not as drying as pure mineral make-up

name: T
review:
I use the product to even out my skin tone.
It's light weight, easy to apply and easy to remove.
I have recommended this product to a few friends already.

name: xoxonotyomama
review: Love it!!! It is a very refreshing surprise when you put it on.

name: Ericka A.
review: My skin is super oily and uneven. I have scars from breakout and I breakout quite often. I've found using a liquid concealer can cover it up, but then I always have a shine and it looks unnatural. I know people typically use liquid or powder, but I like to apply liquid and use powder to soften it up and smooth it out.The Physicians Formula is probably the best I've found, but they don't come in a light enough color for when I haven't been in the sun. And I refuse to pay $30+ for the Laura Mercier loose minerals. So this is where ColorStay comes into play.I love that it is a loose powder and comes in various shades. The price isn't bad at [$]. I think it will last me at least a couple months. I even enjoy the cooling sensation when I apply it. I just wish it had a better brush for applying. The case is kinda bulky for what it is and I've found a thick, fluffy round brush is the best instead of the flat thing they give you.

name: Jan
review: I like this product but it is pricy and doesn't have much in the container.  I have a problem putting it on and waste some because I use a bigger brush than the one that comes with it.  I find the brush that comes with it too little and hard to manage. Therefore, I wouldn't recommend it. I think I'm going to try a different powder on my next purchase.

name: Girl on the go
review:
Every day use.
It feels cool, refreshing & light all day.
Don't care for the brush.

name: Reba
review: It really felt funny the first time I put it on, did not expects it to me cool and moist.  Will cover blemishes and dark circles under eyes better than most.

name: Busy Mom
review: I use to use bare minerals, and I noticed with my skin when it would get humid, the bare minerals would make my face itch. This product is amazing, not irritating at all, and works just as well if not better than bare minerals. The cool sensation upon application is also a major plus.

name: J*doll
review: this powder is not meant as a concealer. it is meant for people who want a lightweight coverage on their face for a very natural, refinished look. if this is what you are looking for in a mineral powder go for it because that's exactly what it is. it has this really wet, cooling sensation that is great in the morning when applying it. great for  work and casual outings when you want your face to look natural and refreshed.

name: Makeup Junkie
review: I did not like this product at all until I tried it with a regular minerals brush, LOVE IT!  It feels so awesome when you are putting it on and does cover well, better than BE I believe.  The small brush that comes with it is good for touch ups so you can just throw it in your purse and go.  Ppl who left negative, if you still have the product try a diff brush, you will love it!

name: Jan
review: I like this product but have difficulty getting it on the brush.  The brush is too small and the container is too small.  I end up getting it on my clothes and my countertop.

name: Tmari
review: I have been searching for the perfect powder since Prescriptives disappeared. I have tried Nars, Loreal, Estee, Clinique, Smashbox, and they've all disappointed. I don't like Bare Minerals in general because the coverage is poor, it makes my skin itch, and I feel I look OLDER when I use it. Bare Minerals Mineral Veil does NOT look good over liquid foundation.  I love this Revlon product because the coverage is easily adjustable--just use another bigger brush (I use Sonia Kashuk's fluffy blush brush) and I can wear it alone or over my liquid foundation and the finish is impeccable.  Don't use the little brush except for touch ups or you may not have the same result. As with any product, you need the right tools for the right end result. I am stocking up on this one!

name: Valeri glez
review: Just bought it yestrday and absolutly love it.

name: Jasmine
review:
I've purchased Revlon products since I was a teenager and have been loyal to them even after discovering many better brands; however, this product made me WRITE A LETTER to the company telling them how bad it was.

Of course, they did offer a full refund --- which I expected they would. But I think they need to get the idea that this product is such a bad, bad idea. Horrible.

name: Jenn
review: I use this product as a powder over your face illuminator

name: KeEsBa
review: While the feeling of dampness from the powder is interesting, it doesn't apply smoothly, and the same color I used to use in the regular version now looks orange-y.  It doesn't stay on as well, either.  When I apply it with the brush, the product sort of gets stuck to the applicator brush and it will not smooth out.  Yuck!!

name: Linda
review: It feels like it's melting onto your skin

name: pat
review: I bought this product thinking it was a loose powder.  When I first put it on, I noticed it went on wet.  I will use it when I'm not going anywhere special, but won't buy it again.  It comes with a brush, but I suggest using a powder puff to put it on.

name: Heidi
review: Great for quick and easy, flawless coverage

name: shunt6575
review: Product feels good when you apply to your face as it goes on wet, but dries quickly.  I don't care for it as it enhanced pores, made me look old, and looked dry.  And yes I used a Primer before applying.  I'm going back to MAC.

name: Steph
review: i really love this product. i love the fact that it feels wet and refreshing when it goes on. i'm 18 and i have a lot of blotchiness and pimples and this foundation really covers them up. but i use an acne product that can dry out my skin and the foundation looks cakey and weird when the dryness is there. but i really do love this product and makes my skintone even and hides my blemishes!!

name: KP
review: N/A

name: MakeupLover
review: This foundation is great for when I don't have much time in the mornings! Or when I'm taking my time for an evening out... I have incredibly oily skin, and I'm super fair, so I'm always worried about having an orange face or that line right under my chin... But this blends so well... I use my own large foundation kabuki brush... And blend in circles... I love it. I'll never buy another foundation.

name: ione
review:
Love it but too dark 0
I can I take it back and exchange it?

name: The Pale Goddess
review:
Provides lightweight coverage which can be layered for a heavier look. It is perfect for wearing as a finishing powder over a foundation if you are seeking a fuller coverage, without looking cakey. Personally I like the subtle "glow" though if you wear it with glitter or other metallic makeup etc. it could be too much.

Comes in a large range of shades and finally a "fair" that is actually not too dark for my porcelain skin.

I wear it everyday over a primer (though it goes on smoothly in-and-of-itself)and have never had a problem with breakouts, lasts even in high humidity and I never have to touch it up. I recommend investing in a higher quality brush than the one included which will help it's application. As to the "wet" feeling, I find it refreshing and though I was skeptical at first as to how well it would stay and whether or not it would slid off my face I was pleased. After you apply it a couple of times you don't notice the feeling anymore so it is really personal preference.

Overall, for the money, it is a good product for those seeking a natural mineral foundation and makes your skin look healthy and radiant.

name: Indian
review: The powder goes on Wet.  It's hard to make it brush on because of the wetness.  Also, the brush in itself is hard on the face.  I always feel like I'm brushing away my primer.  The color is lighter than the names shown.  I bought two and it's really light.  I like the glitter in it and still use it until it's going to be finished.  I may be reluctant to buy it again though.

name: zory
review: The look is natural and I get lots of compliments

name: Daisy
review: This mineral makeup is very natural looking, easy to apply and not badly priced for the quality.

name: Lori the Paralegal
review: Gave sking orangey darker skin color because it would not spread.

name: mel
review: I love this! Been using it for a few years now. I use it after I've finished by foundation to set it. I don't use the brush that comes with it, I use a larger fluffy brush.

name: Susan
review: Love this product

name: jb
review: it felt weird on my skin, and had a orangish tint on me without covering ANYTHING and it smelled weird. completely unsatisfied. But that's just my experience.

name: Ts
review: I have always used this brand and like the cool wet when applying for for some reason this smells bad when it dries. Not happy too expensive for that to happen

name: Tiff
review:
I would not advertise this as a foundation since it is so sheer. I would describe it as a unique hydrating setting powder.

I have dry skin. I like this since it is hydrating for a powder.. where some powders can cling to my dry areas and look flaky like theres, well, powder all over my face, this one does not. It works well to set my revlon whipped cream foundation (which i am in love with.) It doesn't make me look dry and flaky, and leaves a nice natural finish.

It comes with a little paddle style retractable brush cleverly designed so it fits into the lid. It's a nice quality brush, but it likes to retract really easily and is a little small for practical use.. I feel like it is very convenient if you want to put it in your purse or travel with it. I like to use a similar shaped brush thats bigger to put it on.

Theres the initial cool feeling when you apply this- it's pleasant I suppose but it is only when you first apply it and doesn't really affect the overall performance of the product.

This has a little sparkle to it. (I just think it's weird;) if given a choice, I would always go without sparkle. I would give it a perfect rating if it did not have the sparkle! Thankfully it is very subtle so I still like it overall.

name: V
review: As a face powder.

name: Brooke
review: First of all, I love the majority of Revlon foundations, so I was really excited to try their new product in the Colorstay line because of how great it seemed. Plus, the other products in the Colorstay line are great. When I first tested it out, it had sparkles in it like their Photoready line, which is something I got past. I have some redness on my face, along with a few pimples. Normally, any foundations will cover up some of these issues, but this looked like nothing was put on my face. I barely noticed any difference in anything on my face.

name: swtp
review: I love it and will reorder, wish I could get some coupons.

name: MJ
review: This is my base make up.  It's super easy to blend and it dries beautifully and instantly.  I have tried the other mineral over the counter make up and it just doesn't compare at all.  I hope they also add an eye concealer (I haven't seen it on the market (?)

name: Sickcity
review: The brush in this packaging is stiff and scratchy, the texture of the product is crumbly and lumpy, hard to apply. The coverage is very sheer, and it was hard to tell what color I needed by looking at the bottle. I ended up getting one that was too light anyway. I trashed it.

name: Nitro Harley
review: I like how it feels going on and how my face feels throughout the day, not dry, however, the "ColorStay" promise is not lived up to in my opinion.

name: RBSinTX
review: I've been using mineral makeup for a few yrs now and tried this one mostly because it contains titanium dioxide (3.7%). It's hard to find this kind of sun protection in makeup products (I have medium skin that I'm trying to protect due to melasma/hyperpigmentation). Although I also wear sunblock underneath, I feel better that I'm protecting my skin. Instead of the little brush, I've found using my fuller, natural fiber brush worked better for an even application. The wet feeling is weird at first, but now I think it's refreshing. Coverage is great - evens out my skin tone, works well over concealer and blends with mineral bronzer or blush.  A bit of finishing powder downplays the shimmer during the day; and in the evening, I have a healthy glow.

name: Hayley
review: This is actually a pretty good foundation. It offers good coverage, is easy to apply (I use my own powder brush) and lasts a pretty long time on my oily skin. I just wish it didn't have shimmer in it. I didn't notice, unfortunately, until my boyfriend asked if I was wearing body glitter. It only seems to be very noticeable in bright lighting though.

name: lexi
review: I have gone through two containers of this already and I'm buying my third today! I am in love with this product!! The sparkles do sometimes make it a little too shimmery but all-in-all I LOVE THIS STUFF! : )

name: Abby
review: The packaging is fancy, but horrible. I have yet to figure out how to get the little brush out. The powder itself has terrible coverage. I have to use a lot to get it to minimally cover my face. When applied, it feels wet. Literally. I now understood why it has the word 'aqua' in the name. Some people say it feels refreshing, but to me, frankly, it feels strange. The worst part of this product, aside from the fact it does a terrible job of covering anything and easily comes off, is that it's sparkly. I really don't want to look like a vampire when the sun is hitting my face. Because I impulsively bought this without reading any reviews, I will use it until it's gone. At the rate I have to pile it on to get any coverage, hopefully that will be soon.

name: lilu
review:
This is a good foundation and it would be great if it blended just a bit better and did not have glitter.
Because of the glitter I can only wear it at night. Under natural light this foundation doe not look natural because it sparkles a lot.

name: Kbug
review: Bronzer,highlighters, or blushes work really well with it. Best to use it with a large powder brush.

name: Ninny
review: I love the cooling feeling with this product!

name: Robyn
review: Although it's dry, it leaves the skin feeling wet. I used so much drying to cover a blemish to no avail. I absolutely hate it.

name: Jo the makeup snob
review: I use this over a liquid foundation and even sometimes by itself. Great coverage!

name: JSP
review: Great product for the price.  You can apply more for fuller coverage as needed.  I use a better make-up brush to apply which gives an overall better experience and coverage.

name: Amarillo
review: I like the way it feels and blends in to my skin...does not look like it just sits on top of your skin for a makeup look.

name: Zoey
review: I apply it before putting on my blush. It evens out my skin tone and the best part is how very little I need to get the finish look I want.

name: KK
review: This is my go-to lower price point mineral makeup.  I love how it is not drying and almost feels wet when applied.  I think it is as good as Bare Minerals!  And, I can only find it at Ulta.  Most chain stores no longer carry this AquaStay line.

name: Nan
review: I have a lot of red pigmentation in my skin and it is also dry.  After I moisturize, I use a color corrector and then the ColorStay Aqua Mineral makeup.  It stays in place all day yet washes off easily at night.

name: T
review: Easy to apply and blends very well. Gives a glow/bronze look.

name: Rachelmon
review: Only cons are that it came out darker than expected and the brush that comes with it is not reliable.Other than that it's a great product.

name: cloudninegirl
review: I have used Bare Escentuals for years and tried this and LOVE it!

name: JMick
review: This is just weird. At first I thought my brush had fallen into water or something, but no... this really feels wet when you apply it. It's like someone is misting me in the face while I'm trying to get ready. I was surprised that I liked the coverage at first, but through the day I noticed the make up collecting on certain parts of my face (forehead, under eyes, nose) and looking very cakey. This is an interesting gimmick, but that's it. Back it goes.

name: Heather
review: Feels awesome going on - like it's cool and wet but it's a dry mineral makeup.  I love this stuff.

name: nana
review: Easy and Quick!

name: blondie
review: If you have bad skin then this in not the product for you.

name: Kris
review: The "cool" feeling is a bit weird at first, but wonderful.  It blends easily for me and I like the coverage.  I think I'm sold!

name: eg
review: I have super sensitive strange skin, One part of my face is very pale, the other part is red and blotchy then I have a scar from surgery on my face, so make up is a nightmare, I borrowed this stuff from a friend and I love it, I have pretty pale skin but the medium is actually a good cooler (so for people saying it didnt cover well if your pale try medium) Just using this product it actually toned my skin out and hid all my blemishes and color diffrences and stayed on really well, I absolutly cant believe I found a make up that works, didnt break me out,and didnt clump up and covered my scars...

name: A little girl in Tempe
review: When I apply this product on my face, I feel I apply water on my face.

name: Donna
review: The powder is too wet, and makes your face shiny.

name: N
review: One swipe on my face and I knew their new formula with "moisturizing coconut water" wasn't for me.

name: gramma
review: I find this brand to be better for my skin needs than other mineral make-up I've tried..

name: Lydia
review: This product works really well, goes on smoothly, and altogether I have no complaints!

name: casey615
review: I have used Loreal's Mineral Powder for years and thought I would try something new. I have fair skin and my cheeks tend to look a little blotchy without makeup. This product did absolutely nothing to even out my skin tone or minimize the redness. I feel it would be excellent over a foundation if you are looking for coverage... unless you are one of those lucky few with a perfect complexion, in which case you may very well love it.

name: smiling
review: Feels cool and not dry.

name: Mimi
review: I have used this product for years and plan to continue using it forever.

name: AJ
review: Great Product. It also last a longtime (6 - 8 months). Everyday usage.

name: R R
review: I use this product every day and love it.

name: DanniSuzanni
review:
Feels like Noxzema going on - remember Noxzema? Us 35 yr olds do! Feels wet and cold going on, but the first stroke is where all the powder stays. Very challenging to BLEND. Also has glitter/shimmer, which isn't a natural look for work. I mainly use foundation to even out the redness around my nose and mouth (thanks hormones) and found that this didn't last more than a couple hours before the redness started to show again. Packaging makes is difficult to get product onto your brush and tap off excess without making a mess. Why are mineral foundation pots always tall/narrow? Why can't they make wide/flat pots so we can tap off excess without making a mess...

Unfortunately, this was my very first Revlon cosmetic purchase ever (always been a cover GURL and then Urban Decay/Mac/BobbiBrown GURL) and I think I'm going to "Stick to what I know."

Thanks! :) ~Danni

name: Mom Dawn
review: I love it and now my daughter is using it

name: Stacy P
review: I started using this about a year ago and have never looked back...the best powder for non heavy coverage ever! I wish the brush that came with it was larger.

name: mom23jsr
review: I use the product with a kubki brush and it only covers 'so-so'.  It does not stay on the '14 hours' they swear by; frankly not even close! It feels very nice & cooling going onto the skin.  It reminds me of the Prescriptives Magic powder. If you like a very sheer coverage and lightweight feel this should work for you.  I need longer wear and more coverage on a regular day.

name: make-up addict
review: I use this product over a light mosturizer, mineral concealers and a primer. It can last for about 8 hours without the primer, but requires a touch up if you don't. This doesn't have a whole lot of coverage so it won't be good for those who need it. I wanted something that was very light and natural looking and this was perfect for me. The product also has a lot of the light-reflecting minerals in it, which is the result of the "youthful, luminous finish" it is known for. As many other reviews have shown, a GOOD BRUSH is required for this product... the brush it comes with won't do anything for you. I love it however, for applying my under eye and blemish concealer. The bristles are super soft and perfect for those applications. Again, I wouldn't recommend this product for those who need intensive coverage.

name: Nikki
review: I thought this product would apply like regular powdered foundation, but it turns wet when you brush it on. I think its suppose to be part of the cooling effect, but it just kinda makes it muddy. The coverage is poor and it wears off fast. I had to touch up within a few hours. Plus, its good a strange smell added.

name: Ramona
review: I was surprised the first time I applied it--thought my brush was wet.  But the moist feeling quickly subsides.  Convenient storing brush in lid with handle that extends.

name: LadyTigre43
review: Love this product.  I wanted a foundation that was lightweight and can be worn everyday.  It applies so smoothly and doesn't get dry and paste-y.  Looks great and very natural.  Highly recommend.

name: Crazymama
review:
I use this product every single day.
It is very light weight, can't even tell you have make-p on.
The other things i have used was usually off by the end of my work day.
This stays on until i take it off.
I just really like this make-up and I have tried many types and brands over the last 30 years.

name: JNCWORLD
review: Me and my friends all love this foundation, we all love the cold feeling when put on the foundation, give us very nice coverage, it doesn't look like and feel like have makeup on.also looks very good on picture too. this is the best mineral powder foundation.

name: AnnABananA
review: Easily buildable coverage - I love the 'wet' or 'cool' feeling of it as it goes on my skin - it has such a nice, smooth, soft, even finish. Definitely prefer this over bare minerals!

name: Blondie
review: This product looks like powder, but when brushed on it feels like a cool liquid. Coverage is good but not great. Still very good everyday foundation.
